trans-unit.target: Step 6 of the Develop a predictive solution walkthrough: Access an active Azure Machine Learning web service.

trans-unit.source: **Access the web service**
trans-unit.target: **Access the web service**

trans-unit.source: In the previous step in this walkthrough we deployed a web service that uses our credit risk prediction model.
trans-unit.target: In the previous step in this walkthrough we deployed a web service that uses our credit risk prediction model.

trans-unit.source: Now users need to be able to send data to it and receive results.
trans-unit.target: Now users need to be able to send data to it and receive results.

trans-unit.source: The web service is an Azure web service that can receive and return data using REST APIs in one of two ways:
trans-unit.target: The web service is an Azure web service that can receive and return data using REST APIs in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: **Request/Response** - The user sends one or more rows of credit data to the service by using an HTTP protocol, and the service responds with one or more sets of results.
trans-unit.target: **Request/Response** - The user sends one or more rows of credit data to the service by using an HTTP protocol, and the service responds with one or more sets of results.

trans-unit.source: **Batch Execution** - The user stores one or more rows of credit data in an Azure blob and then sends the blob location to the service.
trans-unit.target: **Batch Execution** - The user stores one or more rows of credit data in an Azure blob and then sends the blob location to the service.

trans-unit.source: The service scores all the rows of data in the input blob, stores the results in another blob, and returns the URL of that container.
trans-unit.target: The service scores all the rows of data in the input blob, stores the results in another blob, and returns the URL of that container.

trans-unit.source: The quickest and easiest way to access the web service is through the Web App Templates available in the [Azure Web App Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/web-applications/all/).
trans-unit.target: The quickest and easiest way to access the web service is through the Web App Templates available in the [Azure Web App Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/web-applications/all/).

trans-unit.source: These web app templates can build a custom web app that knows your web service's input data and what it will return.
trans-unit.target: These web app templates can build a custom web app that knows your web service's input data and what it will return.

trans-unit.source: All you need to do is provide access to your web service and data, and the template does the rest.
trans-unit.target: All you need to do is provide access to your web service and data, and the template does the rest.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the web app templates, see [Consume an Azure Machine Learning web service with a web app template](machine-learning-consume-web-service-with-web-app-template.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the web app templates, see [Consume an Azure Machine Learning web service with a web app template](machine-learning-consume-web-service-with-web-app-template.md).

trans-unit.source: You can also develop a custom application to access the web service using starter code provided for you in R, C#, and Python programming languages.
trans-unit.target: You can also develop a custom application to access the web service using starter code provided for you in R, C#, and Python programming languages.

trans-unit.source: You can find complete details in [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been published from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: You can find complete details in [How to consume an Azure Machine Learning web service that has been published from a Machine Learning experiment](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
